etymologies: Middle English: from Old French salvacion, from ecclesiastical Latin salvation- (from salvare ‘to save’), translating Greek sōtēria

definitions: preservation or deliverance from harm, ruin, or loss

examples.text: they try to sell it to us as economic salvation

shortDefinitions: preservation or deliverance from harm or loss

definitions: a source or means of being saved from harm, ruin, or loss

examples.text: his only salvation was to outfly the enemy

shortDefinitions: source or means of being saved from harm or loss

definitions: deliverance from sin and its consequences, believed by Christians to be brought about by faith in Christ

examples.text: the Christian gospel of salvation for all mankind

shortDefinitions: deliverance from sin and its consequences, believed by Christians to be brought about by faith in Christ
